entries.content:
I've created the implementation plan. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created ✓

**Feature:** Add Success, Warning, and Info Alert Variants

### Phases Overview

| Phase | Description | Subtasks | Est. Time |
|-------|-------------|----------|-----------|
| **Phase 1: CSS Color Tokens** | Add new semantic color tokens to globals.css | 4 subtasks | 20 min |
| **Phase 2: Extend Alert Component** | Add new variants to the Alert component | 3 subtasks | 15 min |
| **Phase 3: Testing & Validation** | Unit tests and build verification | 3 subtasks | 25 min |

### Key Implementation Details

1. **Color System:** Following existing OKLCH color pattern used for `--destructive`
   - `--success`: Green (hue 145)
   - `--warning`: Amber (hue 75)
   - `--info`: Blue (hue 235)

2. **Alert Variants:** Following existing `destructive` pattern:
   ```
   success: "text-success bg-card [&>svg]:text-current ..."
   warning: "text-warning bg-card [&>svg]:text-current ..."
   info: "text-info bg-card [&>svg]:text-current ..."
   ```

3. **Files to modify:**
   - `apps/web/src/app/globals.css` - Add color tokens
   - `apps/web/src/components/ui/alert.tsx` - Add variants
   - `apps/web/src/components/ui/__tests__/alert.test.tsx` - Add tests (new file)

### Total Estimated Time: ~60 minutes

The plan is saved to `.auto-claude/specs/005-add-success-warning-and-info-alert-variants/implementation_plan.json`
I'll implement subtask 1.1, which adds the `--success` CSS variable with OKLCH green values. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the patterns and context.

## ✅ Subtask 1.4 Completed

**Summary:** Added Tailwind color mappings for success, warning, and info to the `@theme inline` block in `globals.css`.

**Changes made:**
```css
--color-success: var(--success);
--color-warning: var(--warning);
--color-info: var(--info);
```

**What this enables:**
- Tailwind utility classes like `text-success`, `bg-success`, `text-warning`, `bg-warning`, `text-info`, `bg-info`
- Support for opacity modifiers like `text-success/90`, `bg-warning/50`

**Commit:** `64f3f64` - auto-claude: 1.4 - Add Tailwind color mappings for success, warning, info

**Subtask 3.1 completed successfully!**

## Summary

Created comprehensive unit tests for the Alert component at `apps/web/src/components/ui/__tests__/alert.test.tsx` with **22 test cases** covering:

### Test Coverage:
1. **Alert Rendering** (5 tests)
   - Renders with children
   - Has `data-slot="alert"` attribute
   - Has `role="alert"` for accessibility
   - Merges custom className
   - Passes through additional props

2. **Alert Variants** (6 tests)
   - Default variant with correct classes (`bg-card`, `text-card-foreground`)
   - Default variant when no variant specified
   - Destructive variant (`text-destructive`, `bg-card`)
   - Success variant (`text-success`, `bg-card`)
   - Warning variant (`text-warning`, `bg-card`)
   - Info variant (`text-info`, `bg-card`)

3. **Common Styling** (1 test)
   - All variants have structural classes (`rounded-lg`, `border`, `px-4`, `py-3`, `text-sm`)

4. **AlertTitle** (5 tests)
   - Renders with children
   - Has `data-slot="alert-title"` attribute
   - Has correct styling classes
   - Merges custom className
   - Passes through props

5. **AlertDescription** (5 tests)
   - Renders with children
   - Has `data-slot="alert-description"` attribute
   - Has correct styling classes
   - Merges custom className
   - Passes through props

6. **Component Composition** (3 tests)
   - Complete alert with title and description
   - Alert with icon and content
   - All variants work in composition

**Commit:** `163e5d7` - "auto-claude: 3.1 - Create unit tests for Alert variants"

1→# PageSpace Local Development Guide
     2→
     3→## 1. TECH STACK & ARCHITECTURE
     4→
     5→### 1.1. Core Technology Stack
     6→
     7→- **Full-Stack**: Next.js 15 App Router + TypeScript + Tailwind + shadcn/ui
     8→- **Database**: PostgreSQL + Drizzle ORM (local deployment via Docker)
     9→- **AI**: Ollama (local models) + Vercel AI SDK + OpenRouter + Google AI SDK
    10→- **Auth**: Custom JWT-based authentication (local user management)
    11→- **File Storage**: Local filesystem with metadata in PostgreSQL
    12→- **Real-time**: Socket.IO for live collaboration
    13→- **Deployment**: Docker containers on Mac Studio (local deployment)
    14→
    15→### 1.2. Monorepo Architecture
    16→
    17→This project uses a pnpm workspace with Turbo build system with the following structure:
    18→
    19→- `apps/web`: The main Next.js 15 frontend and backend application
    20→- `apps/realtime`: A dedicated Socket.IO service for real-time communication
    21→- `apps/processor`: File processing service for uploads, image optimization, and content extraction
    22→- `packages/db`: The centralized Drizzle ORM package containing database schema, migrations, and query logic
    23→- `packages/lib`: Shared utilities, types, and functions used across the monorepo
    24→
    25→### 1.3. Key Dependencies
    26→
    27→**Frontend & UI:**
    28→- Next.js 15.3.5 with App Router
    29→- React ^19.0.0 + TypeScript ^5.8.3
    30→- Tailwind CSS ^4 + shadcn/ui components
    31→- TipTap rich text editor with markdown support
    32→- Monaco Editor for code editing
    33→- @dnd-kit for drag-and-drop functionality
    34→
    35→**Backend & Database:**
    36→- Drizzle ORM ^0.32.2 with PostgreSQL
    37→- Custom JWT authentication with jose ^6.0.11
    38→- bcryptjs ^3.0.2 for password hashing
    39→
    40→**AI & Real-time:**
    41→- Vercel AI SDK (ai) ^5.0.12
    42→- @ai-sdk/google ^2.0.6, @ai-sdk/anthropic ^2.0.4, @ai-sdk/openai ^2.0.15, @ai-sdk/xai ^2.0.8
    43→- @openrouter/ai-sdk-provider ^1.1.2 for cloud models
    44→- Socket.IO ^4.8.1 for real-time collaboration
    45→
    46→**State Management:**
    47→- Zustand for client state
    48→- SWR for server state and caching
    49→
    50→## 2. NEXT.JS 15 ROUTE HANDLER REQUIREMENTS
    51→
    52→### 2.1. Breaking Change: Dynamic Route params are Promises
    53→
    54→**CRITICAL**: In Next.js 15, `params` in dynamic routes are Promise objects. You MUST await `context.params` before destructuring.
    55→
    56→```typescript
    57→// ✅ CORRECT Pattern
    58→export async function GET(
    59→  request: Request,
    60→  context: { params: Promise<{ id: string }> }
    61→) {
    62→  const { id } = await context.params; // Must await params
    63→  return Response.json({ id });
    64→}
    65→
    66→// ❌ INCORRECT Pattern
    67→export async function GET(
    68→  request: Request,
    69→  { params }: { params: { id: string } } // WRONG: params is a Promise
    70→) {
    71→  // This will fail in Next.js 15
    72→}
    73→```
    74→
    75→### 2.2. Request Handling Standards
    76→
    77→- **Get Request Body**: `const body = await request.json();`
    78→- **Get Search Params**: `const { searchParams } = new URL(request.url);`
    79→- **Return JSON**: `return Response.json(data)` or `return NextResponse.json(data)`
    80→
    81→## 3. MANDATORY DOCUMENTATION WORKFLOW
    82→
    83→- When changes land, update the changelog and any user-visible notes.
    84→
    85→## 4. DEVELOPMENT STANDARDS
    86→
    87→### 4.1. Code Quality Principles
    88→
    89→- **No `any` types** - Always use proper TypeScript types
    90→- **Explicit over implicit** - Clear, self-documenting code
    91→- **Right-first approach** - Build the ideal solution from the start
    92→- **Consistent patterns** - Follow established conventions
    93→
    94→### 4.2. Critical Patterns
    95→
    96→**Message Content Structure:**
    97→```typescript
    98→// ✅ CORRECT - Always use message parts structure
    99→const message = {
   100→  parts: [
   101→    { type: 'text', text: "Hello world" }
   102→  ]
   103→};
   104→```
   105→
   106→**Permission Logic:**
   107→```typescript
   108→// ✅ CORRECT - Use centralized permissions
   109→import { getUserAccessLevel, canUserEditPage } from '@pagespace/lib/permissions';
   110→const accessLevel = await getUserAccessLevel(userId, pageId);
   111→```
   112→
   113→**Database Access:**
   114→```typescript
   115→// ✅ CORRECT - Always use Drizzle client from @pagespace/db
   116→import { db, pages } from '@pagespace/db';
   117→const page = await db.select().from(pages);
   118→```
   119→
   120→**UI Refresh Protection:**
   121→```typescript
   122→// ✅ CORRECT - Register editing/streaming state to prevent UI refreshes
   123→import { useEditingStore } from '@/stores/useEditingStore';
   124→
   125→// For document editing:
   126→useEffect(() => {
   127→  if (isDirty) {
   128→    useEditingStore.getState().startEditing(id, 'document', metadata);
   129→  } else {
   130→    useEditingStore.getState().endEditing(id);
   131→  }
   132→  return () => useEditingStore.getState().endEditing(id);
   133→}, [isDirty, id]);
   134→
   135→// For AI streaming:
   136→useEffect(() => {
   137→  if (status === 'streaming' || status === 'loading') {
   138→    useEditingStore.getState().startStreaming(id, metadata);
   139→  } else {
   140→    useEditingStore.getState().endStreaming(id);
   141→  }
   142→  return () => useEditingStore.getState().endStreaming(id);
   143→}, [status, id]);
   144→
   145→// For SWR protection (CRITICAL: must allow initial fetch):
   146→import { useRef } from 'react';
   147→import { isEditingActive } from '@/stores/useEditingStore';
   148→
   149→const hasLoadedRef = useRef(false);
   150→useSWR(key, fetcher, {
   151→  // Only pause AFTER initial load - never block the first fetch
   152→  isPaused: () => hasLoadedRef.current && isEditingActive(),
   153→  onSuccess: () => { hasLoadedRef.current = true; },
   154→  refreshInterval: 300000, // 5 minutes
   155→  revalidateOnFocus: false,
   156→});
   157→```
   158→
   159→See [docs/3.0-guides-and-tools/ui-refresh-protection.md](docs/3.0-guides-and-tools/ui-refresh-protection.md) for complete documentation.
   160→
   161→### 4.3. Critical Rules
   162→
   163→**CRITICAL: Package Manager**
   164→- **ALWAYS use `pnpm`** - This is a pnpm workspace project
   165→- **NEVER use `npm`** for install, run, or any other commands
   166→- All scripts in package.json are designed for pnpm
   167→
   168→**CRITICAL: Database Migrations**
   169→- **NEVER manually create or edit SQL migration files** in `packages/db/drizzle/`
   170→- **ALWAYS use Drizzle generate commands**: `pnpm db:generate`
   171→- Migration files are auto-generated from schema changes in `packages/db/src/schema/`
   172→
   173→## 5. CLAUDE CODE INTEGRATION & MCP TOOLS
   174→
   175→### 5.1. MCP Tools Integration
   176→
   177→Claude Code can invoke the MCP/DevTools integration whenever browser automation or diagnostics are needed.
   178→
   179→### 5.2. PageSpace Domain Expert Agents
   180→
   181→PageSpace has 17 specialized domain expert agents with deep knowledge of specific subsystems.
   182→
   183→**Core Infrastructure (5 agents):**
   184→- **Authentication & Security Expert**: JWT tokens, CSRF protection, encryption, rate limiting, session management
   185→- **Database & Schema Expert**: Drizzle ORM, PostgreSQL, migrations, schema design, query optimization
   186→- **Permissions & Authorization Expert**: RBAC, drive membership, page permissions, access control logic
   187→- **Real-time Collaboration Expert**: Socket.IO, live sync, conflict resolution, event broadcasting
   188→- **Monitoring & Analytics Expert**: Logging, tracking, performance metrics, error handling, usage analytics
   189→
   190→**AI Intelligence (3 agents):**
   191→- **AI System Architect**: AI providers, message flow, streaming, model capabilities, provider factory
   192→- **AI Tools Integration Expert**: Tool calling, PageSpace tools, batch operations, search tools
   193→- **AI Agents Communication Expert**: Agent roles, agent-to-agent communication, custom agents
   194→
   195→**Content & Workspace (4 agents):**
   196→- **Pages & Content Expert**: Page types, content management, CRUD operations, tree structure
   197→- **Drives & Workspace Expert**: Drive management, membership, invitations, workspace organization
   198→- **File Processing Expert**: File uploads, processor service, image optimization, content-addressed storage
   199→- **Search & Discovery Expert**: Regex search, glob patterns, multi-drive search, mention system
   200→
   201→**Frontend & UX (3 agents):**
   202→- **Frontend Architecture Expert**: Next.js 15, App Router, components, state management, Zustand, SWR
   203→- **Editor System Expert**: Tiptap, Monaco, document state, auto-save, Prettier integration
   204→- **Canvas Dashboard Expert**: Shadow DOM, custom HTML/CSS, navigation, security sanitization
   205→
   206→**API & Integration (2 agents):**
   207→- **API Routes Expert**: Next.js routes, async params, request handling, error responses, middleware
   208→- **MCP Integration Expert**: MCP tokens, document operations, protocol integration, external tools
   209→
   210→### 5.3. Development Workflow Patterns
   211→
   212→Use the Task tool to launch domain experts; each agent advertises its own capabilities and workflow.
   213→
   214→## 6. PROJECT STRUCTURE
   215→
   216→```
   217→PageSpace/
   218→├── apps/
   219→│   ├── web/              # Next.js 15 App Router main application
   220→│   ├── realtime/         # Socket.IO service (port 3001)
   221→│   ├── processor/        # File processing service (port 3003)
   222→│   └── desktop/          # Electron desktop app wrapper
   223→├── packages/
   224→│   ├── db/               # Drizzle ORM schema & migrations
   225→│   └── lib/              # Shared utilities & types
   226→├── docs/                 # Architecture & guides
   227→│   ├── 1.0-overview/     # Getting started, concepts, API list
   228→│   ├── 2.0-architecture/ # Frontend, backend, features
   229→│

1→import * as React from "react"
     2→import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority"
     3→
     4→import { cn } from "@/lib/utils/index"
     5→
     6→const alertVariants = cva(
     7→  "relative w-full rounded-lg border px-4 py-3 text-sm grid has-[>svg]:grid-cols-[calc(var(--spacing)*4)_1fr] grid-cols-[0_1fr] has-[>svg]:gap-x-3 gap-y-0.5 items-start [&>svg]:size-4 [&>svg]:translate-y-0.5 [&>svg]:text-current",
     8→  {
     9→    variants: {
    10→      variant: {
    11→        default: "bg-card text-card-foreground",
    12→        destructive:
    13→          "text-destructive bg-card [&>svg]:text-current *:data-[slot=alert-description]:text-destructive/90",
    14→        success:
